main event: A light brown colored object, the size and shape of a balloon, was observed circling at an estimated speed between 32-135 mph over Berkeley, California in 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed intermittently for 45 minutes, disappearing and then reappearing.
No sound was heard from the object.
The object was observed visually from the ground at an estimated altitude of 23,320 feet.
The weather conditions included clear skies and winds between 9-21 knots at various altitudes.
The sighting was reported by two witnesses, John Harris and R. Hobson, both from Berkeley, California.
sighted object: Light brown colored object, the size and shape of a balloon
